isis.stitle: TSI 04-12-22 - Convert the International® VT 365 on-road engine emission calibration to off-road engine emission calibration

subjectgroup.subject: Convert the International® VT 365 on-road engine emission calibration to off-road engine emission calibration

geninfo.para: Off-road conversion is being offered to eliminate the catalytic converter due to plugging and performance issues on vehicles that operate at low speeds and loads.

regulation.para: It is against the law to operate a vehicle on any public road or highway with an engine calibrated for off-road emissions.

geninfo.para: This conversion must not be performed on engines that will continue to operate on public roads for any length of time.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, the parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before performing diagnostic or service procedures on the engine or vehicle. Read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service manual and the Engine Diagnostic manual.

geninfo.para: The following are requirements to convert on-road International® VT 365 diesel engine calibration to off-road calibration:

item.para: Electronic Control Module (ECM) must be part 1839368C1, or the ECM/IDM must be upgraded to meet this requirement.
ECM mounting kit must be part 1844247C92.
Calibration of the ECM must be PRG2PA05 or later and the Injector Drive Module (IDM) must be AHZ7AI01, or the ECM/IDM must be upgraded to meet these requirements.
The engine must be 175 horsepower, or must be converted to a 175 horsepower engine (Engine Family Rating Code (EFRC) 2111).

geninfo.para: There are a number of steps that need to be performed by the dealer to send and receive information from International and the environmental staff at the Vehicle Programming Center. The following steps are suggested to perform the off-road conversion and obtain the new off-road emission label. The Vehicle Programming Center will provide the actual steps:

item.para: Change the needed components on the vehicle.
Upgrade the ECM/IDM, if required, to meet requirements.
Enable Road Speed Limit, set for 24 miles per hour or less.
Remove Catalyst muffler, replace with muffler, part 2587076C1.
Send the ECM and vehicle parameters, using the EZ Tech® or compatable computer and program, to International.
Fax the signed form to the Vehicle Programming Center. They will process the parameters and notify the dealer.
Receive the parameters and programs of the vehicle for off-road emission calibration.
Send the following to International Environmental Staff D-575, attention Reconfiguration Team, Melrose Park, to obtain the new emission label, part 1846147C1:
Legible copy of the line set ticket with the full engine serial number
Copy of the signed horsepower quote
Dealer's address and name of person at dealer who needs to receive the new emission sticker

regulation.para: It is against the law to operate a vehicle on any public road or highway with an engine calibrated for off-road emissions.
